match.title: 5th ODI
match.statusText: Sri Lanka won by 2 wickets (with 1 ball remaining)

series.name: Sri Lanka tour of South Africa
series.longName: Sri Lanka tour of South Africa

image.caption: A wide-angle view of The Wanderers
image.longCaption: A wide-angle view of The Wanderers, South Africa v West Indies, 5th ODI, Johannesburg, February 3, 2008

match.hoursInfo: 10.00 start, First Session 10.00-13.30, Interval 13.30-14.15, Second Session 14.15-17.45

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Graeme Smith c Chandimal b Malinga 125 (143b 9x4 4x6 203m) SR: 87.41

dismissalComment.html: taken, Chandimal pulls off a much tougher catch than the one Dilshan spilled previous over, a low full toss that Smith thumped towards midwicket, Chandimal leaps to pluck that overhead catch and end a crucial innings from Smith, who gets an ovation as he walks off

headshotImage.caption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Malinga gets the breakthrough, short of length ball, Petersen decides to play that off the front foot, the ball moves away a hint, Petersen pokes at it, the outside edge results, a good low catch by Mathews at first slip

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: taken, Chandimal pulls off a much tougher catch than the one Dilshan spilled previous over, a low full toss that Smith thumped towards midwicket, Chandimal leaps to pluck that overhead catch and end a crucial innings from Smith, who gets an ovation as he walks off

Senanayake takes his first wicket in ODIs, du Plessis again shuffles down the track, lofts the ball towards long-on, taking the fielder on, he fails to clear him, not enough power to clear Mathews, who calmly collects that after initially moving the wrong way, that's his second catch of the game, that struck the inside-half of du Plessis' bat

dismissalComment.html: Senanayake takes his first wicket in ODIs, du Plessis again shuffles down the track, lofts the ball towards long-on, taking the fielder on, he fails to clear him, not enough power to clear Mathews, who calmly collects that after initially moving the wrong way, that's his second catch of the game, that struck the inside-half of du Plessis' bat

dismissalText.commentary: Graeme Smith c Chandimal b Malinga 125 (143b 9x4 4x6 203m) SR: 87.41

dismissalComment.html: taken, Chandimal pulls off a much tougher catch than the one Dilshan spilled previous over, a low full toss that Smith thumped towards midwicket, Chandimal leaps to pluck that overhead catch and end a crucial innings from Smith, who gets an ovation as he walks off

headshotImage.caption: Albie Morkel player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Albie Morkel player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Albie Morkel player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Albie Morkel player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Albie Morkel run out (Dilshan/Perera) 18 (11b 3x4 0x6 17m) SR: 163.63

dismissalComment.html: Albie is run-out,  not much of a celenbration from the Sri Lankans, full and on the stumps, Albie thrashes it towards midwicket, Dilshan fields, reaslises this time he doesn't need to get the direct hit, throws it to Perera who runs out Albie

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Peterson b Duminy 102 (97b 10x4 0x6 163m) SR: 105.15

dismissalComment.html: gone, JP Duminy isn't the most dangerous of bowlers, but he has got the big breakthrough, he drops the ball a bit short, Sanga wanted to power Duminy out of the park last over as well, this time he ends up chipping it to long-off, Peterson hangs on to the catch

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Albie Morkel player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Albie Morkel player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Lahiru Thirimanne c JA Morkel b Peterson 69 (63b 7x4 0x6 100m) SR: 109.52

dismissalComment.html: oh Sri Lanka, this is ridiculous, a short of length ball from Peterson, slightly quicker, Thirimanne charges out and looks hit that through the off, an outside edge carries nicely to Albie Morkel at short third man, Sanga and Dilshan look very tense in the dressing room

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: this time the cute dab cost Chandimal his wicket, a short ball angling in, Chandimal wanted to get it to third man though there was no room to play that shot, a thin top edge to the keeper, Sri Lanka lose their third

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalComment.html: the end of Mathews, a full toss above the knee height, Mathews was looking to hit that down the ground, ends up chipping it to short cover, where Peterson takes another catch, surely Sri Lanka can't mess this up now?

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: the Joburg crowd yell in delight as Nuwan is bowled first ball, making room and looking to hit that over extra cover, he misses Peterson hits, that crashes into middle and leg, Peterson is ecstatic, six needed off five

oh Sri Lanka, this is ridiculous, a short of length ball from Peterson, slightly quicker, Thirimanne charges out and looks hit that through the off, an outside edge carries nicely to Albie Morkel at short third man, Sanga and Dilshan look very tense in the dressing room

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Upul Tharanga c Duminy b Tsotsobe 46 (39b 7x4 1x6 46m) SR: 117.94

dismissalComment.html: sensational catch from Duminy, Tharanga was looking in great touch here, he's gone for 46 though, Tsotsobe sends in the slower one, Tharanga looks to slice that, off a thick outside edge, the ball swirls over cover, Duminy runs with his back towards the pitch, and then dives forward to pluck the ball even as it fell over his shoulder, South Africa needed something special to end that opening stand

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c †de Villiers b Tsotsobe 41 (49b 5x4 0x6 88m) SR: 83.67

dismissalComment.html: Tsotsobe has struck, a short ball just outside off, inches outside off actually, Dilshan looks to glide that to third man, gets a bottom edge, carries nicely through to de Villiers, is that the last innings by captain Dilshan?

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews c Peterson b Parnell 6 (5b 1x4 0x6 11m) SR: 120

dismissalComment.html: the end of Mathews, a full toss above the knee height, Mathews was looking to hit that down the ground, ends up chipping it to short cover, where Peterson takes another catch, surely Sri Lanka can't mess this up now?

dismissalText.commentary: Thisara Perera c du Plessis b Duminy 2 (8b 0x4 0x6 13m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: forget yorkers, start practising your high full tosses, Duminy sends one of those, Perera looks to end the game in style with a smash over midwicket, he can't get it far enough, the best fielder in the game, du Plessis, pouches that easily, Dilshan and sangakkara signalling a no-ball in the dressing room, umpire signals nothing, that looked to be at an acceptable height

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Nuwan Kulasekara b Peterson 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: the Joburg crowd yell in delight as Nuwan is bowled first ball, making room and looking to hit that over extra cover, he misses Peterson hits, that crashes into middle and leg, Peterson is ecstatic, six needed off five

batsmen.shot: off side drive on front foot

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: Sri Lanka have done it! like in Kimberley they finish it off with a six, over midwicket this time, famous first runs for Senanayake, South Africa did so well to bring it close, but the youngster kept his cool, defending his first ball then unleashing a flat hit for six, Peterson has his hands on his head, the crowd is silenced, not bad for a dead rubber

commentPostTextItems.html: That's the first time a team since New Zealand in 2007 to have chased 300 or more in successive ODIs.

Sri Lanka may have lost the series, but they will be thrilled with the performance of several of their young batsmen. Chandimal has made big strides this series, and Thiriamanne showed off his cool temperament today, with a maiden half-century when the pressure was on.

South Africa, on the other hand, haven't learnt much about their next generation of batsmen. Again it was the big boys who scored most of the runs - Ingram didn't get too much of a chance, du Plessis shone in one game, Petersen didn't make the most of two games at the top. South Africa also need to sort out who their death bowlers are - they lost their head in Kimberley, and today it wasn't exactly top bowling which got the wickets.
This is the second highest successful chase at the Wanderers, after the famous 438 one.
Kishore says: "And thats why Senanayake has come ahead of Malinga."

Dilshan: "Chasing 313 is a tight game always, I thought we could finish easily but they came back well in the end. We batted well in the last two matches, chasing 300-plus. We won the Test in Durban, unfortunately third ODI rained out or we might have won the series. Enjoyed the tour, but personally disappointed with my form, last two matches got back to form."

Man of the Match is Kumar Sangakkara. "It was important to get runs, 3-1 down in the series, important to finish off on a high. Graeme and AB batted beautifully and almost put it beyond us. But our openers started brilliantly, and Thirimanne, a young kid, also came in and performed. Credit goes to those three guys. I got out at the wrong time. ... Senanayake hitting the winning runs with a six was the icing on the cake."

Man of the Series is AB de Villiers. "things have been going my way, delighted with my form at the moment. I thought the boys did really well. Biff did extremely well, I told the press that he was going to come through, and I'm very happy for my man. There's a lot to work on for us, but an happy with the way the boys fought till the end. Every ground supported us really well this series."
AB gets the series trophy and pops the champagne with the rest of the team.
Phew! That's about a wrap for this series from us. See whether Abhishek Purohit has managed to capture all the twists and turns of the game in his report here.
Thanks for the many mails, see you soon!

commentPreTextItems.html: Sachithra Senanayake is the new batsmen. Ahead of Malinga. Why?

commentTextItems.html: dot ball, a length ball on leg stump, defended back towards the bowler, five needed off two, how did it come to this?

dismissalText.commentary: Lahiru Thirimanne c JA Morkel b Peterson 69 (63b 7x4 0x6 100m) SR: 109.52

commentTextItems.html: oh Sri Lanka, this is ridiculous, a short of length ball from Peterson, slightly quicker, Thirimanne charges out and looks hit that through the off, an outside edge carries nicely to Albie Morkel at short third man, Sanga and Dilshan look very tense in the dressing room

commentPreTextItems.html: Rangana Herath walks out. He loves to swing the bat, can he keep his head here? Just take the single, and leave it to Thirimanne

commentTextItems.html: well done, he opens the face and guides the ball towards backward point for a single

dismissalText.commentary: Nuwan Kulasekara b Peterson 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

commentPreTextItems.html: New man Nuwan on strike. Robin Peterson given the ball, that's a big decision from AB. Tsotsobe has overs to spare,. Long-on, long-off, deep midwicket and deep square leg.
Long-on comes in, sweeper cover goes out. Six to get

commentTextItems.html: the Joburg crowd yell in delight as Nuwan is bowled first ball, making room and looking to hit that over extra cover, he misses Peterson hits, that crashes into middle and leg, Peterson is ecstatic, six needed off five

dismissalText.commentary: Thisara Perera c du Plessis b Duminy 2 (8b 0x4 0x6 13m) SR: 25

commentTextItems.html: forget yorkers, start practising your high full tosses, Duminy sends one of those, Perera looks to end the game in style with a smash over midwicket, he can't get it far enough, the best fielder in the game, du Plessis, pouches that easily, Dilshan and sangakkara signalling a no-ball in the dressing room, umpire signals nothing, that looked to be at an acceptable height
another dot ball, the crowd loves it, this ball is pushed towards cover

commentPreTextItems.html: why does it say about South African bowling that JP Duminy needs to bowl so many overs in the death?

commentTextItems.html: a full ball on middle and leg, helped to mid-on, that's a dot ball
another single, all along the ground towards long-off
a length ball outside off, eased to long-off for a single, sensible stuff this from the Sri Lankans

commentPostTextItems.html: Heshan: "Wonder what the "esteemed gentlemen" at SLC will do with this team?
2 consecutive scores of 300+ and a tour to Australia (with similar conditions) coming up."

commentTextItems.html: a full toss on middle and leg, pushed towards mid-on for a single
full and angling across, batsman chases after it but doesn't connect
slices this towards deep point for a single
smoking! Morne bowls his predictable back of a length, hammered to the midwicket boundary for an authoritative four, that is making a statement
Morne was appealing for a caught-behind, it was a ball down the leg side once more, off the pads through to the keeper, Thirimanne races through for a leg bye
wide down the leg side, Morkel doesn't like the call, neither does the crowd, which loudly boos the decision
full and just outside off, Thirimanne wanted to send that into orbit, the ball sails past the bat and through to the keeper
another high full toss, just low enough to not be called a no-ball, defended back towards the bowler
guided down to third man for a single

dismissalComment.html: Albie is run-out,  not much of a celenbration from the Sri Lankans, full and on the stumps, Albie thrashes it towards midwicket, Dilshan fields, reaslises this time he doesn't need to get the direct hit, throws it to Perera who runs out Albie

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Upul Tharanga c Duminy b Tsotsobe 46 (39b 7x4 1x6 46m) SR: 117.94

dismissalComment.html: sensational catch from Duminy, Tharanga was looking in great touch here, he's gone for 46 though, Tsotsobe sends in the slower one, Tharanga looks to slice that, off a thick outside edge, the ball swirls over cover, Duminy runs with his back towards the pitch, and then dives forward to pluck the ball even as it fell over his shoulder, South Africa needed something special to end that opening stand

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c †de Villiers b Tsotsobe 41 (49b 5x4 0x6 88m) SR: 83.67

dismissalComment.html: Tsotsobe has struck, a short ball just outside off, inches outside off actually, Dilshan looks to glide that to third man, gets a bottom edge, carries nicely through to de Villiers, is that the last innings by captain Dilshan?

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Peterson b Duminy 102 (97b 10x4 0x6 163m) SR: 105.15

dismissalComment.html: gone, JP Duminy isn't the most dangerous of bowlers, but he has got the big breakthrough, he drops the ball a bit short, Sanga wanted to power Duminy out of the park last over as well, this time he ends up chipping it to long-off, Peterson hangs on to the catch

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Dinesh Chandimal c †de Villiers b Parnell 20 (35b 1x4 0x6 54m) SR: 57.14

dismissalComment.html: this time the cute dab cost Chandimal his wicket, a short ball angling in, Chandimal wanted to get it to third man though there was no room to play that shot, a thin top edge to the keeper, Sri Lanka lose their third

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Albie Morkel player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Albie Morkel player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Lahiru Thirimanne c JA Morkel b Peterson 69 (63b 7x4 0x6 100m) SR: 109.52

dismissalComment.html: oh Sri Lanka, this is ridiculous, a short of length ball from Peterson, slightly quicker, Thirimanne charges out and looks hit that through the off, an outside edge carries nicely to Albie Morkel at short third man, Sanga and Dilshan look very tense in the dressing room

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews c Peterson b Parnell 6 (5b 1x4 0x6 11m) SR: 120

dismissalComment.html: the end of Mathews, a full toss above the knee height, Mathews was looking to hit that down the ground, ends up chipping it to short cover, where Peterson takes another catch, surely Sri Lanka can't mess this up now?

dismissalText.commentary: Thisara Perera c du Plessis b Duminy 2 (8b 0x4 0x6 13m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: forget yorkers, start practising your high full tosses, Duminy sends one of those, Perera looks to end the game in style with a smash over midwicket, he can't get it far enough, the best fielder in the game, du Plessis, pouches that easily, Dilshan and sangakkara signalling a no-ball in the dressing room, umpire signals nothing, that looked to be at an acceptable height

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Nuwan Kulasekara b Peterson 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: the Joburg crowd yell in delight as Nuwan is bowled first ball, making room and looking to hit that over extra cover, he misses Peterson hits, that crashes into middle and leg, Peterson is ecstatic, six needed off five

dismissalText.commentary: Rangana Herath not out 1 (1b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 100
Sachithra Senanayake not out 6 (2b 0x4 1x6 3m) SR: 300

milestones.description: This is the highest match aggregate (626) involving teams South Africa & Sri Lanka in ODIs

stories.title: Sri Lanka in South Africa, 2011-12
stories.subTitle: Fifth ODI
stories.summary: Wisden's review of the fifth ODI between South Africa and Sri Lanka, Johannesburg, 2011-12

stories.title: Happy to see youngsters perform - Dilshan
stories.subTitle: South Africa v Sri Lanka, 5th ODI, Johannesburg
stories.seoTitle: South Africa v Sri Lanka, 5th ODI, Johannesburg: Happy to see youngsters perform - Dilshan
stories.summary: For the third time on this tour, a Sri Lanka youngster played a vital role in a victory, as Lahiru Thirimanne put in a performance worthy of the Man of the Match award

image.caption: Lahiru Thirimanne scored 69 off 63 balls
image.longCaption: Lahiru Thirimanne scored 69 off 63 balls, South Africa v Sri Lanka, 5th ODI, Johannesburg, January 22, 2012

stories.title: Steely Smith silences dissident voices
stories.subTitle: South Africa v Sri Lanka, 5th ODI, Johannesburg
stories.seoTitle: South Africa v Sri Lanka, 5th ODI: Steely Graeme Smith silences critics
stories.summary: Graeme Smith has had to prove himself to the public and media on many occasions in the last year. In the final game of the home season, he answered them in the best manner possible

image.caption: Graeme Smith directs his celebration towards his team-mates
image.longCaption: Graeme Smith directs his celebration towards his team-mates, South Africa v Sri Lanka, 5th ODI, Johannesburg, January 22, 2012

stories.title: AB masters the scoop
stories.subTitle: South Africa v Sri Lanka, 5th ODI, Johannesburg
stories.seoTitle: South Africa v Sri Lanka, 5th ODI: AB de Villiers masters the scoop
stories.summary: Plays of the Day for the fifth ODI between Sri Lanka and South Africa

image.caption: AB de Villiers moves across to play an audacious lap shot
image.longCaption: AB de Villiers moves across to play an audacious lap shot, South Africa v Sri Lanka, 5th ODI, Johannesburg, January 22, 2012

stories.title: Sri Lanka ride on Sangakkara ton in thriller
stories.subTitle: South Africa v Sri Lanka, 5th ODI, Johannesburg
stories.seoTitle: South Africa v Sri Lanka, 5th ODI: SL ride on Kumar Sangakkara ton in thriller
stories.summary: For once, the choke was almost on the opposition in a game involving South Africa. Sri Lanka almost messed up what had been the perfect big ODI chase

image.caption: Kumar Sangakkara rues his dismissal shortly after getting to his century
image.longCaption: Kumar Sangakkara rues his dismissal shortly after getting to his century, South Africa v Sri Lanka, 5th ODI, Johannesburg, January 22, 2012

stories.subTitle: South Africa v Sri Lanka, 5th ODI, Johannesburg

image.longCaption: After ducks in the first two ODIs, Tillakaratne Dilshan made his first runs of the series, South Africa v Sri Lanka, 3rd ODI, Bloemfontein, January 17, 2012

videos.title: Plenty for Sri Lanka to be happy about - Arnold
videos.subTitle: South Africa v Sri Lanka, 5th ODI, Johannesburg
videos.summary: The tour has highlighted a lot of positives for Sri Lanka, and the youngsters have showen glimpses of what the future could be for the national team
